content: प्रशम् {c4c} <ab>P.</ab> {@--1@} To become calm or tranquil. {@--2@} To be soothed or appeased. {@--3@} To stop, cease, terminate. {@--4@} To be allayed, be quenched or extinguished; प्रशांतं पावकास्त्रं <ls>U. 6</ls>; <ls>Pt. 3. 56.</ls> {@--5@} To decay, wither away. {%--<ab>Caus.</ab>%} {@--1@} To soothe, appease, pacify; <ls>Ms. 8. 391.</ls> {@--2@} To allay, extinguish, quench, put down; त्वामासारप्रशमितवनोपप्लवं <ls>Me. 17.</ls> {@--3@} To remove, put an end to; तं ( अपचारं) अन्विष्य प्रशमयेः <ls>R. 15. 47.</ls> {@--4@} To conquer, vanquish, subdue; <ls>Mk. 10. 60.</ls> {@--5@} To settle, adjust, compose; प्रशमयसि विवादं कल्पसे रक्षणाय <ls>Ś. 5. 8.</ls> {@--6@} To kill, destroy. {@--7@} To cure, heal.
